Deputy President David Mabuza delivering his eulogy at the Special Provincial Official Funeral of the veteran photographer Sam Nzima in Lillydale, Mpumalangapic.twitter.com/0736wHKF0x
Eulogy by Deputy President David Mabuza at the special provincial official funeral of Mr Masana Sam Nzima, Lillydale, Mpumalanga Province https://bit.ly/2IPvrfF

Deputy President #Mabuza: We must be able to say that although the perceptive eye & compassionate lens of the legendary Sam Nzima have gone to rest, we will be able to look our children in the eye and say we are a nation fully in tune with their fears and hopes #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: We must tell young people that to be truly great and to move mountains, they must cultivate love for their people. And they can start by honouring their parents, mothers, the sick, and the elderly #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: We must tell our young people that if a Sam Nzima could hasten our march to freedom, so they too can do more with all the opportunities of modern digital technology and social media #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: When there are so many untruths and so much disharmony, artists must be supported to help our nation live in truth, trust, and peace. In reflecting and interpreting our world, they need to allow us to dream and to hope again #SamNzimaFuneral
Deputy President #Mabuza: To achieve greatness and success in the creative arts, one’s heart and passion must always be with the people and their circumstances. #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: It is people like Sam Nzima, Keorapestse Kgositsile, Hugh Masekela, Miriam Makeba and others that we must fully support to be the critical conscience of our nation and our voice of reason. #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: Those whose vocation is to capture our history, interpret it, and offer us imaginative possibilities deserve all the support they need as we rebuild and unite our society from the ruins and divisions of the past. #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: As we pay our last respect to this great son of the soil, we can humbly claim greatness because Nzima showed us, that greatness is an outcome of extraordinary success against the odds. #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: Bab'Nzima's work should inspire us to focus more on the development of local content (documented & educational) which promotes, debates and strengthens our sense of social and cultural identity as South Africans. #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: Through that popular picture this hero took on that fateful day in June 1976, we have been able to tell our own story using our own perspective and our own narrative. #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: Bab’Nzima and others of his ilk courageously confronted the apartheid system by ensuring that the stories of the oppressed masses are not relegated to footnote of history. #SamNzimaFuneral

DP #Mabuza: Speaking of Nzima, Prof Somadoda Fikeni put it so powerfully when he said: "The photographers are the invisible lot but whose presence are felt in every story. Nzima's picture of Peterson spoke a million words, which no editor or writer could write so articulately.”

Deputy President #Mabuza: We are content that the one photograph that was published at the height of our struggle, was so significant to tell a story more than words could describe. It was listed by Time magazine as one of 100 most influential images of all time #SamNzimaFuneral
Deputy President #Mabuza: Many of the pictures taken by Nzima were not published for us to see & read the message he was communicating through his art #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: Many of our black compatriots never got to realise their dreams, because those dreamsdied an undignified death in the agricultural fields through forced manual labour. Nzima went through the same life experience. #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: Like the lives of many of us who were born in small villages or as farm dwellers, Nzima was born in Bushbuckridge and grew up on the farm where his father worked. He had dreams and aspirations in life. #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: As Vladimir Lenin had correctly observed, “There are decades where nothing happens; and there are weeks where decades happen.” June 16, 1976 was such a day where something so significant to define the history of this country happened. #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: That frozen moment in picture by Nzima changed the course of history and, in no time, nature & character of our struggle against apartheid was changed and became more militant thus pushing the regime to a corner of defeat #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: Just as the senseless killing of peaceful marchers against pass laws in Sharpeville, the 1976 generation also took resistance struggle to a higher level and brought required momentum to the armed struggle and international campaign #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: The facade of apartheid that had for years been sold to international community, was shattered through an incident frozen in eternity by a camera of a photojournalist whose mortal remains lie in front of us today #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: At the height of repressive laws & political violence meted by the apartheid regime on the black majority of our country, the myth and facade of a normal state was instantly broken #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: On behalf of The Presidency, we express our deepest condolences for the loss of Masana Sam Nzima, a giant photographer who through the lenses of his camera, told the story of our struggle for liberation #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza: Today because I am in the presence of the still body of my father, my brother, & my friend, I will ask Peter Magubane & beckon the spirit of Alf Khumalo, Juda Ngwenya to lead us again #SamNzimaFuneral

Deputy President #Mabuza speaks at #SamNzimaFuneral: Today marks a sad end of a chapter of a great life whose work made us believe in the possibility of our freedom. We are at a loss for words with the passing on of this great and yet so humble son of the soil.

President #Ramaphosa: I thank the Ministers in the Presidency @DlaminiZuma and Minister Bathabile Dlamini, the Director General, Dr @cass_lubisi, the Acting Chief of Staff @busani_ngcaweni, my Advisors and rest of the team for supporting me in this work #PresidencyBudgetpic.twitter.com/sffBrRsj31

President #Ramaphosa: It will only succeed if we put aside our narrow interests and pursue the shared future that the people of this country desire.“Ons is almal Suid-Afrikaners, wat hierdie land saam moet bou.”"Kumele sisebenzisane ukwakha isizwe" #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: it is clear that we have entered a new era. It is a new era that holds much promise for renewal, growth and transformation. But it will only succeed if we all work together to make it a reality. #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: I have appointed an inter-ministerial committee comprising the Ministers of Defence, Police, State Security & Justice to address the problem of political killings in KwaZulu-Natal #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: Violence & crime continue to deny our people the peace &security that they deserve, need &demand. We have made several important appointments to strengthen police management, incl. a new Divisional Commissioner of Crime Intelligence and Head of the Hawks.

Presidency #Ramaphosa: National government is working to address the reality that some municipalities are failing at effectively delivering services, billing for services and collecting the revenue due #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: We are particularly concerned by the report of the @AuditorGen_SA that there has been a regression in the overall audit outcomes of municipalities from 2015/16 to 2016/17 #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: @HealthZA is dispatching teams to turn around poorly performing hospitals. It is undertaking work to fill vacant posts and contracting private health practitioners to provide specific services #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: We have neverthless managed to initiate four million people with HIV on antiretroviral treatment, deliver more than 1 million babies a year and provides treatment to 300,000 people with tuberculosis annually #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: Our health system is under great strain. The public health service takes care of 80% of the people in the country, including large numbers of immigrants. Health is indeed an areas of great concern to which we are giving priority attention #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: Our Constitution is an instrument of radical transformation. We should treasure it, we should safeguard it and we should use it to achieve fundamental social and economic change #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: The restoration of the land to the poor and dispossessed through a constitutionally-mandated programme of redress and reform is a revolutionary act. The illegal occupation of land is not #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: We will not be diverted from the pat we are on. We will not shy away from the debate. We will engage, we will consult & we will seek to build consensus. We will not compromise on our determination to resolve the land question in this country, once & for all

President #Ramaphosa: That is why we will not relent in our determination to use expropriation without compensation as one of the mechanisms to effect land reform. We do so understanding that expropriation without compensation is not an end in itself, but a means to an end

President #Ramaphosa: If ownership, tenure and use of this country’s land remains restricted to a small minority, we will never realise the contribution it can make to the growth and development of our economy #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: Land reform is fundamental to the eradication of http://poverty.It is fundamental to restoring the dignity of all South Africans, to foster reconciliation and to forge national unity #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: We must attend to needs of people with different forms of disability within our education & health systems. It is not enough to have a policy on disability – we need programmes to affirm & empower people with disabilities #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: As we work together to overcome the divisions of race, gender and class that have characterised our country over decades, we often overlook the discrimination, oppression and disempowerment of people with disabilities #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: We are hopeful that from the young girls here will emerge a new generation of parliamentarians, ready to take up needs of our people.We are hopeful that from among them will emerge one – or more – of our country’s future Presidents #TakeAGirlChild2Work

President #Ramaphosa: Today is ‘Take a Girl Child to Work Day’, an initiative that demonstrates to the girls of this country that their rightful place in society is wherever their dreams take them.We welcome the learners who are joining us here today as part of this initiative

President #Ramaphosa: We need to prioritise the education of the girl child and remove the impediments that prevent her from completing her schooling and advancing to higher education and training #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: We tend to think that nation building is about reconciling black and white South Africans, yet it is also about reconciling women and men. It is about achieving equality in the home, at schools, in colleges and at universities, in the workplace & elsewhere
President #Ramaphosa: As we work to build a united nation, we need to tear down the barriers that prevent women from occupying their rightful place in society #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: Apartheid flag & Die Stem are not symbols of Afrikaner identity; they are symbols of discrimination, oppression and misery. Barriers to unity exist in the minds of those who would deny that apartheid was a crime against humanity

President #Ramaphosa: We cannot achieve reconciliation until we have torn down the barriers that still divide us.Some of those barriers exist in people’s minds.They exist in the minds of people who think that it is acceptable to sing Die Stem & display the old South African flag.

President #Ramaphosa: Nation building requires that we recognise both the injustices of the past and how the legacy of that injustice endures in the social and economic terrain of the present.When we talk about white privilege and black poverty, we are not talking about the past

President #Ramaphosa: As SAns we are bound together by a set of Constitutional values & principles that clearly differentiate our democratic present from our past. As die Agbare Groeneweld gesê het: “Ons is almal Suid-Afrikaners, wat hierdie land moet bou.” #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: #PresidencyBudget further demonstrated that even though often we disagree, vigorously, we are bound together by a determination to make this country work.We are bound by a desire for a South Africa that is at peace, that is free, just, equal and prosperous.
President #Ramaphosa: #PresidencyBudget provided ample evidence of the dynamism of our democracy, of the ability of our institutions to give a platform to a diversity of views.
President #Ramaphosa has extended his gratitude to all members of Parliament who participated in the debate on the #PresidencyBudget
President #Ramaphosa is in the National Assembly to reply to the debate on the #PresidencyBudget

Deputy President David Mabuza has welcomed the order of the Tshwane North Magistrate’s Court striking off the court roll the application for protection from harassment case brought against him by Mr Jan Venter. https://bit.ly/2s9ufZx
Address by President Cyril Ramaphosa to the African Renaissance Conference, Inkosi Albert Luthuli International Convention Centre, Ethekwini. https://bit.ly/2s89U6Z
President #Ramaphosa addresses 20th Annual #AfricanRenaissance Conference in Durban, KwaZulu-Natal #AfricaDaypic.twitter.com/fJSKdDYZLY

President #Ramaphosa: It is then that our chains will be dissolved, our plains will be red with harvest & our crowded cities will send forth the hum of business. It is then that we will achieve an #AfricanRenaissance. God bless Africa. Nkosi sikelel’ iAfrica. #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: We must constantly remind them of the words of Madiba, who said:“Sometimes, it falls upon a generation to be great. You can be that generation. Let your greatness blossom.” #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: Engineers & artists of ancient times have worthy successors in new generation of young scientists, financiers, coders & designers.Our task is to create conditions for this new generation to grow & thrive to build a continent of hope and progress #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: We must be inspired by our ancestors, whose boundless creativity and majestic works endure today. Egypt's magnificent pyramids, sculptures of the ancient kingdoms of Ghana, Mali & Benin, the temples of Ethiopia, and the rock paintings of the Kgalagadi

President #Ramaphosa: South Africa's new dawn is part of a broader continental dawn of shared growth & prosperity, in which SA retains its position as a gateway to pan-African opportunity for peoples of this continent & our international partners #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: Madiba would have said the expression of discontent & disagreement in KZN through the killing of one another must come to an end. Unity must be underpinned by dialogue & engagement, instead of killing one another we must sit around the table and talk.

President #Ramaphosa: When Madiba spoke of unity, it was not only for Africa but also to us, here in SA and in KZN. If Madiba was around today he would have said, I dream of the unity of our people here in KwaZulu-Natal #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: We remain inspired by the words of Madiba, when he said: “I dream of the realisation of the unity of Africa, whereby its leaders combine in their efforts to solve the problems of this continent.” #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: We continue to be guided & inspired by Kwame Nkrumah of Ghana, Murtala Mohammed of Nigeria, Patrice Lumumba of Congo, Amilcar Cabral of Guinea Bissau, Agostino Neto of Angola, Eduardo Mondlane of Mozambique, Seretse Khama of Botswana, WEB Du Bois #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: In the interconnected world of today where we as Africans assert ourselves as equals – not subjects – in the global governance system & the globalised economy, we are able to sustain the thinking & work pioneered by Ka Seme #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: #ACFTA took place in a continent far removed from the Africa in which Pixley ka Seme penned his essay titled ‘The Regeneration of Africa’.Seme called for all the people in the land to unite & see the continent as equal in its contribution to civilisation

President #Ramaphosa: The #ACFTA places the best that Africa has to offer at the disposal of all Africans and promises to reduce the inequality that exists across national borders #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: In March, the AU Summit in Rwanda reached the historic milestone of an Agreement on the African Continental Free Trade Area. #ACFTA seeks to dissolve barriers to shared opportunity & prosperity, by enabling movement of people, goods & services #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: Hopelessness & despair are being eroded by the expansion of education & entrepreneurship on our continent, and the advancing empowerment of women in African societies and economies #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: It is with a sense of hope and optimism that we find inspiration in the transformation that is sweeping across our continents in waves of varying intensity and size #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: I tell this story of @VolvoCar_SA as it illustrates that achievement of the @_AfricanUnion Vision 2063 relies on seemingly isolated & disparate stories that are unfolding from Amanzimtoti to Abidjan, Algiers and Addis Ababa #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: Impressive young people working for @VolvoCar_SA turn the key on a new Volvo truck every 45 minutes, thanks to the skills, sound working conditions and motivation with which they have been empowered #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: My visit to the South Coast, KZN took me to the Volvo Trucks factory, where Volvo has firmly placed its confidence & its capital in South Africa as a vibrant, productive and profitable investment destination #AfricanRenaissance #AfricaDay

President #Ramaphosa: A few days ago, I was very honoured to be in Amanzimtoti, to interact with global industrial giant, @VolvoCar_SA & a group of highly skilled & productive young South Africans - living proof of how our social & economic landscape is changing for the better

President #Ramaphosa: President #Mandela & Mama Albertina Sisulu, at different time in the history of our continent, bequeathed to us values and behaviours that stand us in good stead in the 21st Century #AfricanRenaissance

President #Ramaphosa: It gives me great pleasure to address #AfricanRenaissance in celebration of #AfricaDay in the year in which we mark the centenaries of two notable Africans – Tata Nelson Mandela and Mama Albertina Sisulu.

President Cyril Ramaphosa has today, 23 May 2018 appointed a commission of inquiry into tax administration and governance in the South African Revenue Service (SARS). https://bit.ly/2KQaWwa

President Cyril Ramaphosa presenting Budget Vote 1 in the National Assembly, Parliament, which is The Presidency Budget Vote covering the work of The Presidency as the nerve centre of government, overseeing the programme of action of all national Government Departments.pic.twitter.com/aVWibvqj5b

#Ramaphosa: As we undertake this important work together, as we travel further along the path of growth and transformation, we are imbued with a new spirit. In truth, it is a spirit rekindled #PresidencyBudgetpic.twitter.com/u09Eemp2Mr
#Ramaphosa: This fund will be launched on the 18th of July to mark the 100th anniversary of Madiba’s birth and will be called the #ThumaMina Fund #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: I have decided to contribute half my Presidential salary to a fund to be managed by the Nelson Mandela Foundation Nelson and will direct resources to the many small social projects scattered across the country #ThumaMina #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: In memory of Madiba, in recognition of the great sacrifices he made and his tireless commitment to improving the lives of the most vulnerable, We are looking for people with skills, time and commitment to ‘lend a hand’ to community-based projects #ThumaMina

#Ramaphosa: From the professionals who mentor young people, to the businesses that support emerging entrepreneurs and the NGOs who care for the homeless, the elderly and the vulnerable, South Africans are coming forward as agents of meaningful change #ThumaMina #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: Across the country, there are many people – many of whom who do not have much themselves – who are working to improve the lives of others. From the churches that are running soup kitchens, to the pensioners who are caring for orphans.. #ThumaMina #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: They want to be there when our economy grows, when we build new factories and create new jobs.They want to be there when women and children can walk the streets of our beautiful country without fear #ThumaMina #PresidencyBudget
#Ramaphosa: They call, they write, they email, they text. They stop you in the street and they say they want to be there for the poor and the hungry and the homeless #ThumaMina #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: At the very heart of our country’s new dawn is a desire by our people to be part of building a brighter tomorrow for all South Africans.Wherever we go, South Africans from all walks of life say: #ThumaMina #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: In all our international engagements, we are guided by the need to advance South Africa’s national interests alongside the promotion of multilateralism, global equality and human rights #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: The interactions we have had with our neighbours in Namibia, Angola, Botswana, Mozambique & Zimbabwe have convinced us that prospects for regional economic integration & cooperation are now greater than ever before. We are committed to push ahead with this agenda

#Ramaphosa: The prosperity of the South African people cannot be separated from the progress of our neighbours on the African continent. For our economy to grow, for our manufacturing output to expand, for our goods and services to find new markets, we need an integrated Africa
#Ramaphosa: The situation in local government requires firm decisions and resolute action, effective monitoring and improved accountability. #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: Our experience in North West has taught us that we should be more actively involved in assisting and support our provinces and giving real meaning and effect to the Constitutional principle of cooperative governance #PresidencyBudget
President #Ramaphosa: Our overriding concern in all matters of governance is to put the people first #PresidencyBudgetpic.twitter.com/4UU8X8jyK7

#Ramaphosa: A review of the size, composition & efficiency of government is being undertaken by a task team led by the Presidency. It is examining in detail the modalities of a state that is leaner, smarter, adaptable & more capable of delivering on its mandate #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: We are revitalising the police force, crucial management appointments are being made and specialised units are being capacitated. The effective functioning of government is a priority #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: Measures have been taken to address challenges in the intelligence services through the appointment of a Review Panel to examine the structure and operational capabilities of the State Security Agency #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: The stabilisation of @sarstax has received priority attention.I have today signed a proclamation establishing a commission of inquiry into tax administration &governance chaired by former judge Nugent, assisted by Mr Michael Katz, Adv Mabongi Masilo and Mr Vuyo Kahla.

#Ramaphosa: We are taking steps to strengthen the criminal justice system, effect leadership changes in key institutions and take action against those implicated in acts of wrongdoing #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: In forging a social compact, govt undertakes to build strong, durable institutions that are accountable, transparent & responsive to the needs of the people. In this regard, one of the most pressing challenges is to deal decisively with state capture and corruption.

#Ramaphosa: We have signed a number of proclamations instructing the SIU to investigate allegations of wrongdoing in a number of SOEs. We are also encouraged by the activism of Parliament, which is demanding accountability and exposing impropriety #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: We have moved quickly to address governance challenges by replacing boards of Denel, Prasa, Transnet & earlier this year, Eskom. The new boards have begun to scrutinise transactions that may be irregular &to improve the functioning of these entities #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: An important part of that effort is the stabilisation of strategic state owned enterprises and the implementation of measures to improve their financial and operational performance #PresidencyBudget
#Ramaphosa: We are working hard to create an environment that encourages investment, to make our country more competitive and to lower the costs of doing business. #PresidencyBudget

President #Ramaphosa: We are working hard to create an environment that encourages investment, to make our country more competitive and to lower the costs of doing business. #PresidencyBudget #PresidentsBudgetVote

#Ramaphosa: It is nearly 100 days since we set out as a nation on a new path of renewal and revival. It is nearly 100 days since we decided, together, to make a clear and decisive break with the discord and division of recent times. #PresidencyBudget

#Ramaphosa: Our task as government is not to give lip service to empowerment of small business but to do the actual work to support their development and expansion #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: South Africa has led the way globally on matters of public interest.Many authorities around the world are now beginning to recognise the importance of supporting public interest through their competition law #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: Some 58,000 jobs were saved and 6,500 jobs created through conditions stipulated by the Competition Authorities through merger proceedings, between April 2014 and the 2016/17 financial year #RamaphosaQandA
#Ramaphosa: It is therefore critical that we continue to pursue measures that will open up the economy for small businesses and black South Africans #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: Small and medium businesses are an important part of the South African economy. They support more than 60% of employment in South Africa, and are engines for growth and transformation #RamaphosaQandA

President @CyrilRamaphosa is today responding to questions for oral reply in @ParliamentofRSA. This is one of the measures through which the President continues to account to Parliament and the nationpic.twitter.com/DXjmGLUp6F
#Ramaphosa: The programmes we have in place are all encompassing and have improved the lives of the people even though much more remains to be done #RamaphosaQandA
#Ramaphosa: Government is focusing its attention on how to improve the lives of the people and that the education outcomes are better than they were in the past #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: To those who are want to go around the world & mobilize internationalal community against their own country, we are saying come back home for inclusive dialogue. The resolution of the land question will be owned by all of us to take SA forward #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: Those who do not have houses must have houses. Those who do not have land must have land. That is a demand that will never go away despite those who reject it. Our people want the land #RamaphosaQandA
#Ramaphosa: Our people want land. They want houses. Let those who say the people must not have land, must not have houses must stand up #RamaphosaQandA
#Ramaphosa: Our people have views on the land, we must give them an opportunity to air them. They are saying we want this wound to heal, we should listen to them #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: It is incumbent upon us to discuss land reform in a positive light rather than sit & pontificate on the matter. Already more than 140 000 submissions have been received by @ParliamentofRSA on the proposal to expropriate land without compensation #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: Foreign investors that we have interacted with over the last few months are increasingly optimistic about the prospects for the South African economy and looking with great interest at possible investment opportunities #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: It is significant that @MoodysInvSvc recently decided to keep South Africa at an investment grade and changed its outlook from negative to stable, affirming the country’s recent political and economic developments #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: We will explain to potential investors that land reform is not incompatible with agricultural productivity and economic development, as the historical experience of some East Asian economies, such as South Korea, demonstrates #RamaphosaQandA
#Ramaphosa: We will advance the three elements of land reform – redistribution, restitution and security of tenure – through inclusive dialogue #RamaphosaQandA
On investment and land reform: For South Africa to grow faster and to build a transformed and inclusive economy, land reform is necessary and urgent #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: @Yes4YouthZA is but one of the many initiatives we have in mind to get young people into the world of work, entrepreneurship and employment. Young people are ready and are awaiting for opportunities. Our focus is young people #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: Youth unemployment is one of the key priorities of our government. Earlier this year we launched the @Yes4YouthZA program, expected to make an impact in the lives of more than 1million young people over 3 year period #RamaphosaQandA
President @CyrilRamaphosa provides feedback to the nation as he answers questions for oral reply at the Nation Assembly today #RamaphosaQandApic.twitter.com/I4bZcPaOc6

#Ramaphosa: All of us have a responsibility to act at all times with dignity, honesty, respect and goodwill – and to ensure that we bring up our children to value and live by such principles #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: We are still trapped by our past, much as we seek to move away from what apartheid wrought on us. The shadow of our past still casts its vision on our future. All of us are called upon to do everything we can do move away from this sad past #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: It is only by ensuring that everyone has the opportunity to acquire useful skills, to find decent employment, to earn a living wage, to have a house and to feel safe, that we will be able to effectively heal the wounds of the past #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: We wish to commend the Honourable Maimane for having made exactly the same statement about white priviledge.We will be the first to defend him against those in his own party who want to deny the reality of racial inequality in South Africa #RamaphosaQandA
#Ramaphosa: “We shall redouble our efforts to build a society in which black poverty and white privilege are consigned to the past.”- @MYANC Jan. 8 Statement
#Ramaphosa: There are other wounds that have still not healed. The violence of poverty, homelessness and hunger continues to afflict millions of our people #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: We are particularly concerned at the apparent increase in instances of femicide, where women have been killed by their partners. There is a responsibility on all of us, particularly men, to ensure that such crimes do not occur #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: In many ways, we remain a violent society, where murder, assault, rape and other ‘contact’ crimes are still widespread.The alarming levels of violence against women and the abuse of children are a damning indictment on our society #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: Apartheid violence took the form not only of state repression, but also the dispossession of people’s land, the destruction of their livelihoods and the exploitation of their labour #RamaphosaQandA
#Ramaphosa: The system of apartheid was built and sustained through the violent suppression of the political, social and economic rights of the black majority #RamaphosaQandA
On wounds of the past: The colonial conquest of our country, which began over 300 years ago, was achieved through violence and brutality #RamaphosaQandA

#Ramaphosa: We are going to hold members of the executive accountable, in a transparent manner, to all the things they get involved in. Where there is wrongdoing, including by myself, we will act #RamaphosaQandA

Condolence books for the late Mama Winnie Madikizela–Mandela will be available at the Airports, DIRCO: Head Office, Parliament, Tuynhuys, Union Buildings, Department of Arts&Culture, Department of Communication: Head Office, all Provincial Legislatures and all Premier’s Offices.

“In consultation with the family, government will host a memorial service at the Orlando Stadium, Soweto on the 11th April 2018 followed by a funeral service on the 14th April 2018 at the same venue,” Minister in the Presidency, Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma.

“All members of the public are invited to come out in their numbers to celebrate the life and legacy of Winnie Madikizela-Mandela,” Minister in the Presidency, Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma on the Special Official Funeral of the Late Mrs Winnie Madikizela-Mandela.

“We call on all political parties, faith based organisation and civil society to work in cohesion during the mourning period including the memorial and funeral services,” Minister in the Presidency, Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma on the Special Official Funeral of the late Mama Winnie.

“As we pay tribute and celebrate her life, let us reflect on what we do to ensure we continue her legacy of fighting for social justice," Minister in the Presidency, Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma on the Special Official Funeral of the late Winnie Madikizela-Mandela.

“Mama Winnie dedicated her life to fight for the, reduction of poverty, the abolishment of racial injustices as well as the struggle for gender equality,” Minister in the Presidency, Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma on the Special Official Funeral of the late Winnie Madikizela-Mandela.

“We acknowledge the messages of condolences that have been received from various Heads of States and eminent persons across the globe,” Minister in the Presidency, Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma on the Special Official Funeral of the late Winnie Madikizela-Mandela.

“On behalf of our government, we want to thank everyone across the globe for their overwhelming show of support to the family,” Minister in the Presidency, Nkosazana Dlamini Zuma on the Special Official Funeral of the late Winnie Madikizela-Mandela.

Address by President Cyril Ramaphosa at the 4th Annual Ubuntu Awards, Cape Town International Convention Centre, 22 March 2018. https://bit.ly/2DOy5Ln
President Cyril #Ramaphosa delivering the keynote address at the #UbuntuAwards2018 in Cape Town this evening.pic.twitter.com/StfdGBHZAo
#Ramaphosa Working together, we can build a better today – and an even better tomorrow – for everyone. I thank you.

#Ramaphosa It is incumbent upon us to pursue the vision and ideals of President Mandela. As we celebrate your individual achievements, so too do we recognise that your work is part of a broader effort to change the world for the betterment of humanity.
#Ramaphosa You are the standard bearers of an active citizenry that embraces the principle and practice of Ubuntu. We must draw inspiration from Ma Sisulu’s selfless service to the people.
#Ramaphosa It is therefore fitting that we applaud all nominees this evening, who have taken it upon themselves to fly our flag high as South African ambassadors in various fields of excellence.
#Ramaphosa In this era of renewal, we are guided by Vision 2030 of the National Development Plan, which enjoins us to transform our society for the benefit of all South Africans.
#Ramaphosa In the State of the Nation Address last month, we detailed our plans to rebuilding our economy, create jobs and tackle poverty. I call on our people to own these endeavors.
#Ramaphosa We must strive to strengthen public-private partnerships in pursuit of a decent life for all.

#Ramaphosa We encourage our people to participate in domestic and international endeavors through active citizenry. Our people cannot be spectators in the development and management of their own affairs.
#Ramaphosa We will work with our partners in all these bodies to develop the African continent and establish ties of mutual benefit between the countries of the South.

#Ramaphosa This provides South Africa with several opportunities to advance Nelson Mandela’s vision of a world order that advances above all else the interests of the poor, marginalised, oppressed and exploited.

#Ramaphosa Likewise we are chairing the Southern African Development Community (SADC) and the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA), positions that we assumed in August & October 2017 respectively. Furthermore we are going to assume the chair of the BRICS formation later this year.

#Ramaphosa This is an important year in the implementation of our international programme to fight poverty, inequality and unemployment. South Africa continues as the co-chair of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation (FOCAC), which we assumed in 2015.

#Ramaphosa Through the Kigali Declaration, we have undertaken to ratify all related instruments in accordance with our domestic laws and process. We are a continent that is making steady progress towards shared prosperity.

#Ramaphosa As South Africa, we are proud to have signed the Kigali Declaration on the Establishment of the Continental Free Trade Area, signifying our unequivocal commitment to the achievement of this free trade area.

#Ramaphosa In this context, we returned in the early hours of this morning from the AU Extra-Ordinary Summit held in Rwanda on the African Continental Free Trade Agreement. This was a milestone event in our long journey towards an integrated continental economy.
#Ramaphosa This is borne out by the AU’s Agenda 2063, which envisions a continent united in growth, development and prosperity for all.

#Ramaphosa We are proud of all the nominees because their efforts resonate with their commitment to improve the living conditions of our people. What we aspire to achieve as a country is aligned with what the peoples of the entire continent seek to achieve.

#Ramaphosa President Mandela spared no energy in pursuit of a just, fair and equitable world. We have gathered here today to honour those who have distinguished themselves in pursuit of the dream Madiba and Ma Sisulu shared.
#Ramaphosa ...and the scourge of civil wars and external aggression and unburdened of the great tragedy of millions forced to become refugee.” #UbuntuAwards2018

#Ramaphosa In his acceptance speech at the Nobel Peace Prize Award Ceremony in December 1993, he said: “This must be a world of democracy and respect for human rights, a world freed from the horrors of poverty, hunger, deprivation and ignorance, relieved of the threat...
#Ramaphosa These activities will recall and reinforce President Mandela’s vision of a world defined by peace, human dignity and decency.
#Ramaphosa In Madiba’s honour, the AU decided to convene a dedicated meeting at the 31st Ordinary Session of its Assembly in Mauritania in July 2018 #UbuntuAwards2018

#Ramaphosa We acknowledge their roles in the struggle for the liberation of our country and their commitment to be disciplined and loyal servants of our people. At the African Union Summit in January 2018, we launched a year-long Mandela centenary celebration #Mandela100

#Ramaphosa We commit ourselves never to repeat past mistakes. This year is particularly important in the life of our nation as we celebrate the centenary of the births of our struggle icons Tata Nelson Mandela and Mme Albertina Nontsikelelo Sisulu.

#Ramaphosa Yesterday we commemorated Human Rights Day under the theme ‘Promoting and Deepening Human Rights across Society’. On this day, we remember the tenacity and indomitable spirit of our people and pledge to ensure that their resolve in standing up against injustice endures
